channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: Growing mangoes in Greece is the latest bizarre climate change experiment as droughts become the norm
item.description: Olives, watermelon and lettuce are being replaced by mangoes, avocados and macadamia nuts.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: See what Google’s original office looked like when it started in Susan Wojcicki’s garage
item.description: "As long as you guys pay your rent on time, you guys can build your Googly thing here," Susan Wojcicki recalled telling Larry Page and Sergey Brin in 1998.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: Kamala Harris vows not to interfere with the Fed—unlike Trump
item.description: “The Fed is an independent entity, and as president, I would never interfere in the decisions that the Fed makes."

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: Even an uptick in inflation is unlikely to spoil a Fed rate cut in September
item.description: The consumer price index on Wednesday is expected to have risen 0.2% from June for both the headline figure and the so-called core gauge that excludes food and energy.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: Argentina’s economic shock therapy and fintech boom are wiping out peso notes
item.description: All tangible signs suggest the reign of peso banknotes is ending.
